Parameters: int no parameter comment Value is STATE_STOPPED, STATE_STARTED or STATE_STALLED.

int no parameter comment Value is REASON_BY_USER_REQUEST, REASON_END_OF_SESSION, REASON_FREQUENCY_CONFLICT, REASON_OUT_OF_MEMORY, REASON_NOT_CONNECTED_TO_HOMECARRIER_LTE, REASON_LEFT_MBMS_BROADCAST_AREA or REASON_NONE.
onStreamStateUpdated(int, int).Description: Called to indicate this stream has changed state. See @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#STATE_STOPPED_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#STATE_STARTED_E@ and @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#STATE_STALLED_E@.
onStreamStateUpdated(int, int).FullName: public void onStreamStateUpdated (int state, int reason)

onMediaDescriptionUpdated().Description: Called to indicate the mpd of a the stream has changed. Depending on the Dash Client it may need to be either reset (less drastic, but original spec didn't allow mpd to change so not always supported) or restarted. This may be called when a looping stream hits the end or when parameters have changed to account for time drift.

Parameters: String: A human-readable message generated by the middleware for debugging purposes. This value may be null.
onError(int, java.lang.String).Description: Called by the middleware when it has detected an error condition in this stream. The possible error codes are listed in @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors_E@.
onError(int, java.lang.String).FullName: public void onError (int errorCode, String message)

onStreamMethodUpdated(int).Description: Notify of bcast/unicast method being used. This is intended to be informational. Indicates whether we're able to use cell broadcast or have had to fallback to unicast for this stream. This must be called once at the beginning of the stream around the same time as we change to STATE_STARTED, but strict ordering is not specified. It must be called again if we change modes, but if that doesn't happen the callback won't be used again. See @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#BROADCAST_METHOD_E@ and @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#UNICAST_METHOD_E@

Parameters: int: The error code. Value is @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#ERROR_NO_UNIQUE_MIDDLEWARE_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#ERROR_MIDDLEWARE_LOST_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#ERROR_MIDDLEWARE_NOT_BOUND_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_MIDDLEWARE_NOT_YET_READY_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_MIDDLEWARE_TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_IN_E911_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_NOT_CONNECTED_TO_HOME_CARRIER_LTE_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_UNABLE_TO_READ_SIM_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#GeneralErrors#ERROR_CARRIER_CHANGE_NOT_ALLOWED_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#StreamingErrors#ERROR_CONCURRENT_SERVICE_LIMIT_REACHED_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#StreamingErrors#ERROR_UNABLE_TO_START_SERVICE_E@, or @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors#StreamingErrors#ERROR_DUPLICATE_START_STREAM_E@
String: A human-readable message generated by the middleware for debugging purposes. This value may be null.
onError(int,java.lang.String).Description: Called by the middleware when it has detected an error condition in this stream. The possible error codes are listed in @B_android#telephony#mbms#MbmsErrors_E@.
onError(int,java.lang.String).FullName: public void onError (int errorCode, String message)

onStreamStateUpdated(int,int).Description: Called to indicate this stream has changed state. See @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#STATE_STOPPED_E@, @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#STATE_STARTED_E@ and @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingService#STATE_STALLED_E@.
onStreamStateUpdated(int,int).FullName: public void onStreamStateUpdated (int state, int reason)

onBroadcastSignalStrengthUpdated(int).Description: Broadcast Signal Strength updated. This signal strength is the BROADCAST signal strength which, depending on technology in play and it's deployment, may be stronger or weaker than the traditional UNICAST signal strength. It a simple int from 0-4 for valid levels or @B_android#telephony#mbms#StreamingServiceCallback#SIGNAL_STRENGTH_UNAVAILABLE_E@ if broadcast is not available for this service due to timing, geography or popularity.

ClassDesc: A callback class for use when the application is actively streaming content. The middleware will provide updates on the status of the stream via this callback.
